title: Transgression
verses: Psalm 51:1-4 (WEB) — "Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, blot out my transgressions. Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity. Cleanse me from my sin. For I know my transgressions. My sin is constantly before me. Against you, and you only, I have sinned, and done that which is evil in your sight…"
Proverbs 28:13 (WEB) — "He who conceals his sins doesn’t prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy."
Isaiah 1:18 (WEB) — "“Come now, and let us reason together,” says Yahweh: “Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow. Though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.”"

Colossians 2:13-14 (WEB) — "You were made alive together with him, when he forgave us all our trespasses, wiping out the handwriting in ordinances which was against us… and he has taken it out of the way, nailing it to the cross."
Romans 4:7-8 (WEB) — "“Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, whose sins are covered. Blessed is the man whom the Lord will by no means charge with sin.”"
body: Mercy meets honest confession. In Christ the record of debt is nailed to the cross; you are blessed—covered and clean—to walk again in joy.
prayer: Create in me a clean heart, O God. Restore to me the joy of Your salvation and uphold me with a willing spirit. Amen.
